image.altText: Keegan Palmer competing in the men's skateboarding park preliminaries at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Reigning champion Keegan Palmer is joined by Australian teammate Keefer Wilson in the men's skateboarding park final, as Matt Wearn celebrates another gold in the men's dinghy. Follow live.

title.children: Aussies chasing more skateboarding gold, Wearn creates history with consecutive sailing titles

image.altText: A childhood educator sitting at a table with several young kids

props.synopsis: The federal government has announced it will fund a 15 per cent wage increase for early childhood education workers, tied to a commitment from childcare centres to limit fee increases.

title.children: 'It's not babysitting': Early childhood educators set for bumper wage increase

image.altText: A smiling man in a green and gold jacket standing in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: A County Court judge told the former Victorian teacher he was deluded in thinking that he was in a "relationship" with his victim, who he continued to pursue after court orders were imposed.

title.children: Former teacher jailed for sex offences told there is no such thing as a consenting child

image.altText: A black sports car on the back of a tow truck

props.synopsis: Two men laundered more than $60 million using a scheme involving huge wads of cash, bank accounts and cryptocurrency, a Victorian court is told.

title.children: Men face deportation after being jailed over 'eye-watering' money laundering scam

image.altText: a large group of workers in high-vis shirts gathered at a park. CFMEU branding can be seen in the background

props.synopsis: Court documents reveal the Fair Work Commission has fined the CFMEU and its members more than 2,600 times in 21 years.

title.children: Fair Work says CFMEU broke the law thousands of times, costing members millions

image.altText: General view of the Olympic rings with the Eiffel Tower in the background

props.synopsis: An Australian hockey player has been arrested in Paris, the Australian Olympic Committee has confirmed.

title.children: Australian hockey player arrested in Paris allegedly trying to buy cocaine

image.altText: A house under construction.

props.synopsis: The Independent Broad-based Anti-corruption Commission has charged two Victorian Building Authority employees with criminal offences, over the alleged assessment of builder registrations in exchange for bribes.

title.children: Two Victorian Building Authority workers charged by corruption watchdog

image.altText: Two drivers using a long implement to drill into a coral reef colony underwater

props.synopsis: Scientists have been able to look at corals like tree rings to work out how warm the Coral Sea has been each summer across four centuries. They say the results reveal an alarmingly urgent need to turn around the trajectory of climate change.

title.children: Coral Sea's hottest summer in 400 years puts Great Barrier Reef on verge of 'in danger' status again

image.altText: Three small buildings reduced to rubble.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has met with his top defence and security officials to discuss what he called the "indiscriminate shelling of civilian buildings", with Ukrainian officials yet to comment.

title.children: Vladimir Putin accuses Ukraine of 'large-scale provocation' in Russia's Kursk region

image.altText: Rhydian Cowley and Jemima Montag, arm in arm, holding Australian flags over their heads, in front of the Eiffel Tower

props.synopsis: Australian duo duo Jemima Montag and Rhydian Cowley create their own slice of Olympic history, claiming bronze in the inaugural Olympic marathon race walk in Paris.

title.children: Montag, Cowley snare bronze in marathon walk relay

image.altText: Female basketball player Alanna Smith shoots the ball with one hand, with two defenders around her trying to block

props.synopsis: For the first time since 2012, the Australian Opals are into the Olympic semifinals after defeating Serbia.

title.children: Opals guaranteed to play for a medal after quarterfinal win over Serbia

image.altText: Muhammad Yunus waves at the camera with a small smile on his face

props.synopsis: The Nobel laureate says he wants to hold fresh elections in "a few months" in Bangladesh.

title.children: 'Get ready to build the country': Muhammad Yunus rallies Bangladesh ahead of taking lead of interim government

image.altText: A red Crowdstrike logo on a phone in the foreground, and the Microsoft Blue Screen of Death in the background

props.synopsis: CrowdStrike releases its analysis of last month's global IT outage, revealing an "embarrassing" mistake experts say first-year programming students are taught how to avoid.

title.children: CrowdStrike reveals root cause of global outage, and it's a mistake first-year programming students learn about

image.altText: A digitally altered image showing a teenage girl performing an aerial inversion on a skateboard and depicting her smiling.

props.synopsis: Arisa "The Robot" Trew wasn't always a skateboarder, but after ditching the surf because it was too cold she joined a growing number of Gold Coasters making it to the big time in the sport.

title.children: How the Gold Coast's surfing culture shaped the youngest gold medallist in Australian history

image.altText: A photo of Sarah Carter.

props.synopsis: Tributes are being paid to former three-time Maribyrnong mayor Sarah Carter who was found dead in her home on Tuesday. Victoria Police said there were no suspicious circumstances.

title.children: Former Maribyrnong mayor Sarah Carter found dead in Melbourne's west

image.altText: A red dot north-east of Melbourne indicates the epicentre of an earthquake on a map.

props.synopsis: Seismologists believe the quake, which occurred north-east of Melbourne about 4am, is an "aftershock" from a larger earthquake which caused building damage in 2021.

title.children: Hundreds of Victorians feel impact of 4.1-magnitude earthquake near Melbourne

image.altText: A ban crouches on a branch of the historic banyan tree, which has been charred and b

props.synopsis: Despite being charred and blackened, the 151-year-old banyan tree has revived with the help of arborists and conservationists.

title.children: Lahaina almost lost their oldest banyan tree to wildfires. Here's how they're bringing it back to life

image.altText: Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen in a blue dress.

props.synopsis: The man who assaulted Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen was sentenced to four months in jail.

title.children: Polish man who assaulted Denmark's prime minister sentenced, set to be deported

image.altText: Principal Johnson playing a board game with students in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Despite featuring in some state and territory curriculums, research suggests very little is being taught on climate change, with some teachers actively avoiding the topic as "too controversial" or "too hard".

title.children: How these young students are learning about climate change in a way that keeps them 'hopeful'

image.altText: Small fossil bone in palm of hand.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 700,000-year-old arm bone fossil and two teeth on the Indonesian island of Flores is shedding light on how the tiny, now-extinct human Homo floresiensis evolved.

title.children: This tiny arm bone fossil sheds light on the early human species known as the 'hobbit'

image.altText: A close up of a woman with glasses walking ahead

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds has accused her former staffer Brittany Higgins and her now-husband David Sharaz of planning a premeditated attack on her character in the lead up to her interview on Channel 10.

title.children: Linda Reynolds always believed Brittany Higgins's rape allegations, defamation trial hears

image.altText: Don Farrell wearing a suit and tie looks off into the distance.

props.synopsis: The federal government is close to finalising its plan for broad changes to election laws, including spending limits, donation limits and truth standards for political ads.

title.children: As Labor inches closer to electoral reform, a 'consensus' approach looks far from certain

image.altText: women with her head in her hands looking stressed at her computer

props.synopsis: Many women don't realise perimenopause can begin as early as in their 30s, and that symptoms such as depression and "brain fog", can last for 10 to 15 years.

title.children: 'I thought I was way too young': Perimenopause is taking women by surprise

image.altText: A hole shows where the panel was very close to where passengers sat

props.synopsis: Workers from the embattled airplane company told the US transport safety authority a lack of accountability led to safety issues such as those on the Alaska Airlines plane where a cabin door was missing four bolts and blew out mid-flight.

title.children: 'Garbage' safety culture at Boeing to blame for cabin door blowout mid-flight, watchdog hears

image.altText: The Israeli Iron Dome air defence system fires to intercept an attack, shown in the night sky with streaks of light.

props.synopsis: Iran and its Lebanon-based proxy Hezbollah have vowed retaliation against Israel after senior Hamas and Hezbollah figures were killed. This is what we know about the weapons they have.

title.children: As tensions in the Middle East escalate, here's what we know about Hezbollah and Iran's weapons

image.altText: A close up of Yahya Sinwa at a rally among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: The announcement comes almost a week after Ismail Haniyeh was killed by a blast in Iran.

title.children: Hamas announces Yahya Sinwar as new leader after assassination of Ismail Haniyeh

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference__45ca69940707cdd3e542a6d38cc18b74

props.synopsis: Tuesday's Reserve Bank outcome looks to have curbed Anthony Albanese's scope for a visit to the governor-general before the end of the year.

title.children: Did the RBA just kill Albanese's early election?

image.altText: A gold coin with the image of bluey

props.synopsis: NSW Police said that 64,000 of the limited edition, unreleased coins based on characters from television show Bluey were stolen from a warehouse in Western Sydney.

title.children: Man charged with stealing over $600k worth of Bluey 'dollarbucks' under Strike Force Bandit

image.altText: a crowd of thai politicians do a thumbs-up gesture

props.synopsis: Thailand's Constitutional Court has ruled to dissolve the opposition Move Forward Party (MFP). Here's why it is unlikely to signal the end of the popular group.

title.children: Thai court dissolves progressive Move Forward Party, orders 10-year ban on executives

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles while unwrapping a burger

props.synopsis: Only a few weeks ago, many Americans outside Minnesota had never heard of Tim Walz. Now, he might be the country's next vice-president. Here's what to know about him.

title.children: He came up with the Democrats' new favourite insult against Trump. Now Tim Walz is Harris's running mate

image.altText: Three people on a podium with medals, two are biting them.

props.synopsis: Untold amounts of blood, sweat and tears go into getting to the top step of the Olympic podium. So what's the financial pay-off at the end of it all?

title.children: What's a medal win worth? Here's how much some countries are paying their Olympic medallists

image.altText: Various people seen in a crowded suburb of Sydney

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns's department secretary says employees who moved as a result of work-from-home arrangements may need to be flexible.

title.children: NSW government workers ordered back into office told they will need to be flexible

image.altText: Australian personnel approach one of the boats at Kuri Bay.

props.synopsis: Farmers in northern Australia say an influx of illegal fishing boats poses a significant biosecurity risk the government is failing to address.

title.children: Farmers question government's commitment to biosecurity after illegal fishing boats caught in northern WA

image.altText: A composite of three gold medal winners. Left to right: Noemi fox, cam mcevoy and Saya Sakakibara

props.synopsis: Australia has to win a few more gold medals to beat any records this Olympic Games.

title.children: How well is Australia doing in the Paris 2024 Olympics?
